intro: Pternopetalum cuneifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pternopetalum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
